Thereâ€™s also an introductory blog post outlining â€œwhy itâ€™s important to design and write CSSÂ defensivelyâ€.

â–¶Â Â Is Sass Still Relevant? â€” Vitaly Friedman talks to Stephanie Eckles about whether Sass is still relevant in 2022 and if it adds any value to modern CSS workflows. ~30 minutes. TranscriptÂ available. In related news, Adam Laki asks why use Sass?

Smashing Magazine podcast

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Version 102 of Firefox is out now. Here's the changes that affect devs. In related news, Thunderbird 102, basically the e-mail client yin to Firefox's browser yang, has also been released.

  • Can I Devtools? It's like Can I Use and Can I Email, but for the browser devtools we all rely on.

  • It may surprise you as to how Apple makes those striking 3D effects as you scroll. Steve Sewell shares a video looking at how it's done (his account is well worth a follow BTW).

  • Curious as to how image compression works (JPEG in particular)? â–¶ï¸ This video digs into the detail with particularly high production values.

  • The JavaScript specification has a new (more permissive) license.

Una Kravets

They are moving towards being built in lower level languages like Rust to improve the speed and performance while also adding â€œunbundled developmentâ€ using ES modules to improve the local developmentÂ experience.

Courier.com sponsor

Eric Bailey

Kenji Baheux (Chrome Developers)

Geoff Graham

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

Andy Bell

'Apple Is Not Defending Browser Engine Choice'
Alex Russell opinion

Hired

BunnyWay

UI Haven

Blob Animation: Generate An SVG-Based Smooth Blob Animation â€” Includes lots of options to customize the â€˜blobâ€™ including animation speed and ability to add a background image to the shape, after which you can download as SVG or copy the inlineÂ code.

Aldison Lluka

Wensen Wu

items.title: What would a Chrome only web look like?
items.content:
#â€‹547 â€” June 22, 2022 | Read on the web
What Would a Chromium-Only Web Look Like?

Browser engines do much of the heavy lifting of managing the complexity and nuances of the web â€”Â and weâ€™re blessed to have three major, open source ones â€” but if some in the Chromium community are arguing for â€œa Chromium-only Webâ€ (and there are some strong rebuttals to this claim), then just what happens if that one day becomes a reality? Mark Nottingham shares his thoughts on theÂ matter.

â†’Â  mnot.net/blog/2022/06/22/chromium-only

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word â€” Frustrated with your project management software? Shortcut is a goldilocks solution for software engineers, product managers, and designers, providing the ease of use of a simple tool with the power and flexibility of an overly complexÂ one.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 147 with Safari 16Â Features â€” Available for download for macOS Monterey 12.3 or later and the macOS Ventura beta. Includes several of the new Safari 16 features that debuted at WWDC, such as: Passkeys, Safari Web Extensions improvements, Web Inspector Extensions, Flexbox Inspector, andÂ more

Jon Davis

Pop-ups Are Dead, Long Live Pop-ups: Or 'The Bait-and-Switch Hidden in a Cookie Announcement' â€” The UK government is said to be planning to â€˜kill cookie pop-upsâ€™ as part of its post-Brexit Data Reform Bill, but thereâ€™s more to it than that, as Heather expertly lays out in this opinionatedÂ piece.

Heather Burns

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • :has support in Chrome? Yup, shipping in version 105.

  • Version 9.1 of developer browser Polypane is out now, adding form autofilling, outline panel overlays, and more.

  • Do you need a CSS reset? This Twitter thread is filled with interesting suggestions.

  • Here's an annoying quirk in Safari for iOS: full-screen videos can overlap each other.

  • A quick note for those of you with a .af domain...

  • Sure, Chrome has that dino game, but did you know you can go surfing in Edge? Summer vibes in the browser. ğŸ˜

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Precise Timing with the Web Animations API â€” Working with timers in JavaScript can quickly get complicated. Kirill takes a look at how the Web Animations API could eliminate the need for such timers in certainÂ cases.

Kirill Myshkin

Better Scrolling Through Modern CSS â€” We typically donâ€™t spend a ton of time thinking about scrollbars, but hereâ€™s a few things you can quickly do to customiseÂ them.

Mayank

How GitHub Thinks About Browsers â€” This is an interesting dive into how GitHub is used across various browsers, what the company does to monitor such usage, and what they then do to ensure a solid user experience across the board (progressive enhancements, older browser support, etc).

Keith Cirkel

Observability for Your Frontend Tests â€” Get instant, real-time visibility into the performance of your test suite with Buildkite TestÂ Analytics.

Buildkite Test Analytics sponsor

The Guide to Windows High Contrast Mode â€” How to go about making your sites friendly for Windows High Contrast Mode users by using a good set of practices, including the media query forced-colors and itsÂ toolset.

Cristian DÃ­az

text-overflow: ellipsis Considered Harmful? â€” A note on the downsides of constraining content throughÂ CSS.

Eric Eggert

Internet Explorer Still Hasn't Gone Away â€” As is always the case, there are some exceptions to theÂ rule.

Adrian Roselli

Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container
Preethi

The Rise and Fall of Neumorphism
Jeff Cardello

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

Scroll Btween: Use Scroll Position to Tween Any CSS Values on DOM Elements â€” Scrolling/parallax libraries tend to feel the same but this one demonstrates some diverse examples with colors, images, and text â€” all with noÂ dependencies.

Olivier Blanc

Grid Auto Fit for Tailwind CSS: A Tailwind Plugin to Create a Responsive Grid Without Media Queries â€” A useful CSS technique regardless of Tailwind, but this uses grid-template-columns: autofit as a basis for theÂ concept.

Thirus

Startups Like Brex, Doordash, Plaid and Ramp Use Retool to Build Internal Tools 10x Faster

Retool sponsor

TinyWow: A Collection of Online Tools to Manipulate Files â€” Various utilities to edit, convert, and otherwise work with PDFs, images, videos, CSV, EPUB, URLs, andÂ more.

Box20

#HEXWORDS: A Gallery of Searchable Hex Colors That Are AlsoÂ Words â€” A niche use case admittedly, but a bit of fun nonetheless â€”Â examples include the well-known #BADA55 along with more obscure ones like #DEC0DE, #CABB1E, #EFFACE, and soÂ on.

Paolo Ricciuti

âœ¨ QUICK RELEASES

This is a new section we'll include from time to time, quickly highlighting some recently updated and popular projects and GitHub repos of relevance in the frontend space:

Boring Avatars 1.7 â€“ Generates custom, SVG-based avatars.
simple-icons 7.2 â€“ SVG icons for popular brands.

flag-icons 6.5.1 â€“ An SVG collection of all country flags â€” plus the CSS.
